properties: Doppel does a quick horizontal jab with her left hand, prone to being low-profiled. Mainly used to check jump-ins after a RG or in combos, 2A is preferred in every other situation.

variations.notes: Doppel does a quick horizontal jab with her left hand, prone to being low-profiled. Mainly used to check jump-ins after a RG or in combos, 2A is preferred in every other situation.
Doppel does a quick horizontal jab with her left hand, prone to being low-profiled. Mainly used to check jump-ins after a RG or in combos, 2A is preferred in every other situation.

properties: Doppel does an uppercut. Large safe hitbox, fast startup, and great untech. Used in most of her combos. Prone to whiffing on crouching opponents.

variations.notes: Doppel does an uppercut. Large safe hitbox, fast startup, and great untech. Used in most of her combos. Prone to whiffing on crouching opponents.
Doppel does an uppercut. Large safe hitbox, fast startup, and great untech. Used in most of her combos. Prone to whiffing on crouching opponents.

properties: Doppel does a punch with her right hand. Completely disjointed hitbox with great juggle and startup, hits where c5B can't. Used in optimal juggles due to it incurring less scaling than c5B, although it requires awkward spacing.

variations.notes: Doppel does a punch with her right hand. Completely disjointed hitbox with great juggle and startup, hits where c5B can't. Used in optimal juggles due to it incurring less scaling than c5B, although it requires awkward spacing.

Doppel does a punch with her right hand. Completely disjointed hitbox with great juggle and startup, hits where c5B can't. Used in optimal juggles due to it incurring less scaling than c5B, although it requires awkward spacing.

properties: Doppel headbutts the opponent, moving her forward.

variations.notes: Doppel headbutts the opponent, moving her forward.
Doppel headbutts the opponent, moving her forward.

moves.moveName: Maiden Straight  乙女ストレート
properties: Doppel twists her body in a long punch to the gut, punching forward with a large hitbox. This is Doppel's preferred launcher with IC and hard knockdown without. Although it's extremely punishable, when spaced correctly it's very safe and hard to contest, you can couple it with 2B and 214A to make it harder to punish. Ideal ender midscreen for setting up spacing for jC/2A mixups.

variations.notes: Doppel twists her body in a long punch to the gut, punching forward with a large hitbox. This is Doppel's preferred launcher with IC and hard knockdown without. Although it's extremely punishable, when spaced correctly it's very safe and hard to contest, you can couple it with 2B and 214A to make it harder to punish. Ideal ender midscreen for setting up spacing for jC/2A mixups.

Doppel twists her body in a long punch to the gut, punching forward with a large hitbox. This is Doppel's preferred launcher with IC and hard knockdown without. Although it's extremely punishable, when spaced correctly it's very safe and hard to contest, you can couple it with 2B and 214A to make it harder to punish. Ideal ender midscreen for setting up spacing for jC/2A mixups.

properties: Doppel throws a short straight jab from her crouching position. Safe, privileged jab that beats 4.33+ (3f in Gold) startup jabs (like half the cast normally, or EVERYONE in Gold) and usually hits both high and low-profile moves.

variations.notes: Doppel throws a short straight jab from her crouching position. Safe, privileged jab that beats 4.33+ (3f in Gold) startup jabs (like half the cast normally, or EVERYONE in Gold) and usually hits both high and low-profile moves.

Doppel throws a short straight jab from her crouching position. Safe, privileged jab that beats 4.33+ (3f in Gold) startup jabs (like half the cast normally, or EVERYONE in Gold) and usually hits both high and low-profile moves.

properties: Doppel extends her body and punches at the opponent's feet. Has lower forward invincibility which makes it a potent poking and general pressure tool.

variations.notes: Doppel extends her body and punches at the opponent's feet. Has lower forward invincibility which makes it a potent poking and general pressure tool.
Doppel extends her body and punches at the opponent's feet. Has lower forward invincibility which makes it a potent poking and general pressure tool.

properties: Doppel does a multi hitting uppercut, launches the opponent upwards, scales terribly, and has poor untech time. Very slow and hard to apply as an anti-air despite how it looks and is terrible in combos.

variations.notes: Doppel does a multi hitting uppercut, launches the opponent upwards, scales terribly, and has poor untech time. Very slow and hard to apply as an anti-air despite how it looks and is terrible in combos.

Doppel does a multi hitting uppercut, launches the opponent upwards, scales terribly, and has poor untech time. Very slow and hard to apply as an anti-air despite how it looks and is terrible in combos.
The second hit of Doppel's 2C uppercut. Has better frame advantage than the first hit and deals more damage, making it important to confirm into the full sequence.
The second hit of Doppel's 2C in Enlightened form. Remarkably fast and plus on block, allowing for continued pressure or combo extensions even on block.

properties: Doppel does a quick, downward aerial jab. The size of the hitbox and length of the active frames make this move superb at contesting for aerial space.

variations.notes: Doppel does a quick, downward aerial jab. The size of the hitbox and length of the active frames make this move superb at contesting for aerial space.
Doppel does a quick, downward aerial jab. The size of the hitbox and length of the active frames make this move superb at contesting for aerial space.

properties: Doppel does a quick aerial uppercut, sends the opponent upward on air connect. Useful for air-to-air situations where the opponent is above you or in niche combos.

variations.notes: Doppel does a quick aerial uppercut, sends the opponent upward on air connect. Useful for air-to-air situations where the opponent is above you or in niche combos.
Doppel does a quick aerial uppercut, sends the opponent upward on air connect. Useful for air-to-air situations where the opponent is above you or in niche combos.

properties: Doppel punches towards the ground. Sends the opponent directly down at a fast speed on aerial hit with a large untech time. The hitbox on this move is gigantic and boasts long active frames which makes this an excellent mixup tool. A staple of Doppel oki.

variations.notes: Doppel punches towards the ground. Sends the opponent directly down at a fast speed on aerial hit with a large untech time. The hitbox on this move is gigantic and boasts long active frames which makes this an excellent mixup tool. A staple of Doppel oki.

Doppel punches towards the ground. Sends the opponent directly down at a fast speed on aerial hit with a large untech time. The hitbox on this move is gigantic and boasts long active frames which makes this an excellent mixup tool. A staple of Doppel oki.

properties: Doppel does a dashing version of 5A. Better to use 662A as 66A has less travel distance, has longer startup, and is far less advantageous.

variations.notes: Doppel does a dashing version of 5A. Better to use 662A as 66A has less travel distance, has longer startup, and is far less advantageous.
Doppel does a dashing version of 5A. Better to use 662A as 66A has less travel distance, has longer startup, and is far less advantageous.

properties: Doppel performs a quick leaning downward punch. This move can whiff at point blank and on crouchers, mostly used for juggle combos and pressure strings.

variations.notes: Doppel performs a quick leaning downward punch. This move can whiff at point blank and on crouchers, mostly used for juggle combos and pressure strings.
Doppel performs a quick leaning downward punch. This move can whiff at point blank and on crouchers, mostly used for juggle combos and pressure strings.

properties: Slightly faster 5C, travels and causes a wall bounces on air hit. Used in her corner combos for its high damage and wall bounce.

variations.notes: Slightly faster 5C, travels and causes a wall bounces on air hit. Used in her corner combos for its high damage and wall bounce.
Slightly faster 5C, travels and causes a wall bounces on air hit. Used in her corner combos for its high damage and wall bounce.

properties: Doppel does a dashing version of 2A. Mostly used in pressure and for positioning during wallbounce loops.

variations.notes: Doppel does a dashing version of 2A. Mostly used in pressure and for positioning during wallbounce loops.
Doppel does a dashing version of 2A. Mostly used in pressure and for positioning during wallbounce loops.

properties: Identical to 2B except it travels, amazing poke. Used mostly as a poke with red IC in stock to convert into combos.

variations.notes: Identical to 2B except it travels, amazing poke. Used mostly as a poke with red IC in stock to convert into combos.
Identical to 2B except it travels, amazing poke. Used mostly as a poke with red IC in stock to convert into combos.

properties: Similar to 2C, but the hitbox on Doppel's body is a lot bigger. Launches on hit and is a crucial part of her combos, often used to cheaply combo into 214214A or for her optimal blue IC midscreen combos.

variations.notes: Similar to 2C, but the hitbox on Doppel's body is a lot bigger. Launches on hit and is a crucial part of her combos, often used to cheaply combo into 214214A or for her optimal blue IC midscreen combos.

properties: Doppel leaps forward holding her opponent and slams their head into the ground. Deals more damage than raw 41236* and has faster startup than 41236C, but is slower out of a dash.

variations.notes: Doppel leaps forward holding her opponent and slams their head into the ground. Deals more damage than raw 41236* and has faster startup than 41236C, but is slower out of a dash.
Doppel leaps forward holding her opponent and slams their head into the ground. Deals more damage than raw 41236* and has faster startup than 41236C, but is slower out of a dash.

properties: Doppel falls forward with her opponent in an almost identical manner to her ground throw. Unlike most throws, this is not invincible during active and can trade.

Doppel transforms into a fire tornado with a disembodied head and travels a short distance towards the opponent. This move has lower-body invincibility which is great for matchups with lots of low pokes, like Nayuki (Awake). Best used with IC.
Travels further than the A version and has upper-body invincibility instead. Very good anti-air and approach tool with IC in stock.

Doppel doesn't move in this version and has full invincibility. Doppel's main fully invincible reversal. Leaves Doppel very vulnerable if this move is baited. Costs 50% RF to use (25% if the gauge is light blue).
This move has lower-body invincibility which is great for matchups with lots of low pokes, like Nayuki (Awake).

properties: Doppel pours spicy kimchi into her mouth and breathes fire.
Great disjoint for poking that lingers even when Doppel is hit, often trading in Doppel's favor.
A version is fast but unsafe on block (-12). B version is safer (+2) but slower.
C version has a larger flame and infinite untech time, but requires RF to use.
Especially powerful in Gold Doppel form with faster startup and less disadvantage.

variations.notes: Fast version with good combo potential. Unsafe on block (-12), best used at safe distance. Works as a combo starter with IC or with difficult 662A > 5AB links at point blank/corner.
Enlightened version with much faster startup and safer on block. Can be canceled into from 66C/662B and converted from with 66C/662C/66B.
Safe on block (+2) but slower startup. Decent meaty when spaced correctly. Not as versatile as a combo starter since it launches higher, requiring IC to convert.
Enlightened version with even greater frame advantage (+5.66). Excellent for pressure and safer meaty setups.
Larger flame with longer active frames. Can be combo'd without IC thanks to infinite untech time, though heavily scaled. Requires RF to use.
Enlightened version with faster startup and less disadvantage on block. Still maintains infinite untech time for combo potential.

properties: A slow command throw that ※can be comboed into but requires a very close confirm. Mainly used as a gimmick to catch opponents off guard due to its significant range, being able to throw even after a blockstring.

An anti-air throw that ※can be comboed into. Doppel's main combo ender, it's very easy to combo into and grants a left/right mix-up even in the corner. Despite how it looks, it's a poor anti-air as it targets the smaller collision box.
A standard command throw, cannot be combo'd into and has very poor range. Powerful after RGing a jump-in that the opponent cannot double jump cancel. Does not require RF to use.

variations.notes: A slow command throw that ※can be comboed into but requires a very close confirm. Mainly used as a gimmick to catch opponents off guard due to its significant range, being able to throw even after a blockstring.

An anti-air throw that ※can be comboed into. Doppel's main combo ender, it's very easy to combo into and grants a left/right mix-up even in the corner. Despite how it looks, it's a poor anti-air as it targets the smaller collision box.
A standard command throw, cannot be combo'd into and has very poor range. Powerful after RGing a jump-in that the opponent cannot double jump cancel. Does not require RF to use.

properties: The guaranteed ender if you just want okizeme and don't want to risk the scramble after a tech.
Can be IC'd unlike the rest of the follow-ups, although it does nothing.
※ Can be replaced with 236A/B follow-ups.
This is the high damage follow-up to 41236*, able to be further followed up with unique supers.
Each follow-up super costs 1 bar each, so a full chain takes 2 bars.
Depending on the character, this follow-up crosses up, you can read more in the table below.
• 236A follow-ups (including this one) can be escaped with the C button.
• Must be inputted after the opponent stops shaking in Doppel's hand.
※2 Can be followed up after hitting with 236A/B.
Doppel repeatedly punches the opponent into the ground.
• 236A follow-ups (including this one) can be escaped with the C button.
• Must be inputted as the opponent hits the ground.
※3 Can be followed up with 236236A/B, only before the 23rd hit.
Doppel lifts the opponent up and explodes them in the same manner as her 236236C super.
Gives similar okizeme to 6C, allowing you to perform 669/IAD oki for a left/right or a high/low safe jump.
• 236A follow-ups (including this one) can be escaped with the C button.
Doppel jumps offscreen for a moment before crashing down onto the opponent.
Deals more damage than Maiden Finger follow-up but sacrifices okizeme.
Near the corner you can get a similar left/right to automatic follow-up on characters with mid/slow wake-ups.
• 236B follow-ups (including this one) can be escaped with the B button.
Doppel delivers a single explosive punch the opponent on the ground.
• 236B follow-ups (including this one) can be escaped with the B button.
• Must be inputted as the opponent hits the ground.
※3 Can be followed up with 236236A/B, up until Doppel fully stands up.
Doppel dives head first into the opponent and scrapes them across the screen until exploding at the wall.
This move hits more times the longer it travels, making it the preferred ender when facing away from a corner.
However you cannot get okizeme off this follow-up, even against slow wake-ups.
• 236A follow-ups (including this one) can be escaped with the C button.
Doppel creates 3 fire eruptions in quick succession in the same manner as her 214214C super.
Gives similar okizeme to 6C, allowing you to perform 669/IAD oki for a left/right or a high/low safe jump.
• 236B follow-ups (including this one) can be escaped with the B button.
Doppel throws the opponent up and behind her, dealing no damage.
Has no untech time so Doppel can freely combo them after.
This follow-up has a couple of weird character/port-specific interactions.
• 236B follow-ups (including this one) can be escaped with the B button.
• Must be inputted after the opponent stops shaking in Doppel's hand.
The opponent jumps up and back out of wherever Doppel's hands are, denying her follow-up and returning to neutral.
Notes about Teching:
• The first button you press during the tech window has priority and will be your "chosen" tech.
• If both B and C are pressed at the same time during the tech window, it will give you B tech.
• Pressing A or S during the tech window locks you out of teching.
• On certain tech stages against certain characters (i.e. Mizuka mashing B on Stage 2+), Doppel can be meatied as you leave the tech animation.
Doppel rushes forward to grab the opponent and lift them into the air, exploding them.
All versions have invulnerable frames on startup and can be used against certain attacks.
Higher versions (B/C) gain more invincibility and range, but cost more super meter.
Can be used as a combo-ender in the corner or as a punish against specific moves.

variations.notes: Base version with a few invulnerable frames on startup. Occasionally useful at point blank against armor moves (like Rumi) or specific attacks (like Kano's Soul Strike).
Mid-strength version with higher damage and range than A. Fully invincible until recovery. Can be used as a catch-all reversal and OS with 214214B against cross-up okizeme.
Strongest version with the highest damage and range. Fully invincible until recovery. Can punish moves like Shiori's 236* at fullscreen thanks to its extended range and invincibility.

properties: Doppel causes an eruption of fire to burst from the ground. This move is Doppel's bread and butter. Used in her juggles when the opponent is too far away for other juggle options.
Same as A version, now with one extra eruption. Has the worst damage efficiency of the three versions.

Same as A version, now with two extra eruptions, extremely hard to combo out of. Has niche use as a meter dump after a heavily scaled combo to forcefully corner carry or close out a round, or some rare BIC combos. This has the least proration of all three 214214* moves, but costs the most along with being very slow. Notes about 214214B/C: The extra eruptions give Doppel more recovery, making her far more punishable and making follow-ups impossible outside of the corner. The extra eruptions can occasionally whiff due to launch height and some character's air hurtboxes, especially in the corner.
Has the worst damage efficiency of the three versions.
The extra eruptions give Doppel more recovery, making her far more punishable and making follow-ups impossible outside of the corner.
The extra eruptions can occasionally whiff due to launch height and some character's air hurtboxes, especially in the corner.

variations.notes: The basic single-hit version. Causes a single eruption from the ground with decent damage and the best recovery. Doppel's bread and butter move for juggle combos.
Enlightened version of A. Has the same eruption pattern but with reduced recovery frames, making it slightly safer to use.
First hit of the B version. Creates an initial eruption identical to the A version but leads into a second eruption.
Second hit of the B version. Has the worst damage efficiency of the three versions, but can help with corner carry.
Enlightened version of the B variant. Has the same dual eruption pattern but with less overall recovery time.
First hit of the C version. Creates an initial eruption similar to the A version but leads into a sequence of three eruptions total.
Second hit of the C version. Part of the full three-hit sequence that deals significant damage but greatly increases recovery time.

Final hit of the C version. Has niche use as a meter dump after a heavily scaled combo to forcefully corner carry or close out rounds. Has the least proration of all versions but costs the most and is very slow.
Enlightened version of the C variant. Maintains the triple eruption pattern with somewhat reduced recovery time compared to the normal version, though still highly punishable.

properties: Doppel enters her "Enlightened" install for the rest of the match.
Activates automatically when all five conditions are met:
• Doppel has 1/6th health or less (half of normal FM threshold)
• Doppel has 3 SP bars
• Doppel is on the ground
• Doppel has returned to idle stance (not attacking or in stun)
• It is the final round (both players one round from victory)
While enlightened, Doppel gains these benefits:
• Faster movement (walk speed especially improved)
• Faster moves (all normals and 623/214 specials)
• Passive meter generation (1 bar every 5+ seconds)
• Almost always plus on block (except 6C)
• Can perform infinites with 66B and 662A (1f links)
Rarely impactful due to how close to death activation occurs.
